author: jsalvata
msg: * Undid an erroneous change in TestBeanGui.configure, which I did just out of analogy with TestBean.prepare.
* Moved wrapInProperty to where it can be private.
* The ultimate beanification challenge: removed the addTestElement from the HTTPSamplerBean and added generic code in the TestBean that should be able to perform the same function (hopefully).
* Also made an attempt to put multiple properties per line, but failed, so it's not committed.
* Added the possibility to provide a non-null initial value for the property editors.
* Added the possibility to supress the Edit and/or Undefined options in the property editor combo. This had lots of consequences...
* Had to move the control of correctness for keyed-in values to the itemStateChange event processing. Not easy, you'll see...
Obvious TODO: support the case with no tags, noEdit and noUndefined.

author: jsalvata
msg: Fix errors that occured when I tried the new
GTK Look & Feel. Not that they are important, but
they may bite us in the future.
BTW, it turns out that "name" is a very bad name choice for
a property of an object that subclasses an AWT Component,
because Components already have such property...
